00110 /* Get periodic prints from idle loop, from clock seconds or rtimer interrupts */
00111 /* Use of rtimer will conflict with other rtimer interrupts such as contikimac radio cycling */
00112 /* STAMPS will print ENERGEST outputs if that is enabled. */
00113 #define PERIODICPRINTS 1
00114 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00115 //#define PINGS 64
00116 #define ROUTES 600
00117 #define STAMPS 60
00118 #define STACKMONITOR 600
00119 uint32_t clocktime;
00120 #define TESTRTIMER 0
00121 #if TESTRTIMER
00122 uint8_t rtimerflag=1;
00123 struct rtimer rt;
00124 void rtimercycle(void) {rtimerflag=1;}
00125 #endif
00126 #endif

00132 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00133 /*----------------------Configuration of the .elf file---------------------*/
00134 #if 1
00135 /* The proper way to set the signature is */
00136 #include <avr/signature.h>
00137 #else
00138 /* Older avr-gcc's may not define the needed SIGNATURE bytes. Do it manually if you get an error */
00139 typedef struct {const unsigned char B2;const unsigned char B1;const unsigned char B0;} __signature_t;
00140 #define SIGNATURE __signature_t __signature __attribute__((section (".signature")))
00141 SIGNATURE = {
00142   .B2 = 0x05,//SIGNATURE_2, //ATMEGA1284p
00143   .B1 = 0x97,//SIGNATURE_1, //128KB flash
00144   .B0 = 0x1E,//SIGNATURE_0, //Atmel
00145 };
00146 #endif
00147 
00148 /* JTAG, SPI enabled, Internal RC osc, Boot flash size 4K, 6CK+65msec delay, brownout disabled */
00149 FUSES ={.low = 0xe2, .high = 0x99, .extended = 0xff,};

00201 /* Get a pseudo random number using the ADC */
00202 static uint8_t
00203 rng_get_uint8(void) {
00204 uint8_t i,j;
00205   ADCSRA=1<<ADEN;             //Enable ADC, not free running, interrupt disabled, fastest clock
00206   for (i=0;i<4;i++) {
00207     ADMUX = 0;                //toggle reference to increase noise
00208     ADMUX =0x1E;              //Select AREF as reference, measure 1.1 volt bandgap reference.
00209     ADCSRA|=1<<ADSC;          //Start conversion
00210     while (ADCSRA&(1<<ADSC)); //Wait till done
00211         j = (j<<2) + ADC;
00212   }
00213   ADCSRA=0;                   //Disable ADC
00214   PRINTD("rng issues %d\n",j);
00215   return j;
00216 }
00217 
00218 #if CONTIKI_CONF_RANDOM_MAC
00219 static void
00220 generate_new_eui64(uint8_t eui64[8]) {
00221         eui64[0] = 0x02;
00222         eui64[1] = rng_get_uint8();
00223         eui64[2] = rng_get_uint8();
00224         eui64[3] = 0xFF;
00225         eui64[4] = 0xFE;
00226         eui64[5] = rng_get_uint8();
00227         eui64[6] = rng_get_uint8();
00228         eui64[7] = rng_get_uint8();
00229 }
00230 #endif
00231 
00232 #if !CONTIKI_CONF_SETTINGS_MANAGER
00233 /****************************No settings manager*****************************/
00234 /* If not using the settings manager, put the default values into EEMEM
00235  * These can be manually changed and kept over program reflash.
00236  * The channel and bit complement are used to check EEMEM integrity,
00237  * If corrupt all values will be rewritten with the default flash values.
00238  * To make this work, get the channel before anything else.
00239  */
00240 #if AVR_WEBSERVER
00241 extern uint8_t eemem_mac_address[8];     //These are defined in httpd-fsdata.c via makefsdata.h
00242 extern uint8_t eemem_server_name[16];
00243 extern uint8_t eemem_domain_name[30];
00244 #else
00245 #ifdef MAC_ADDRESS
00246 uint8_t eemem_mac_address[8] EEMEM = MAC_ADDRESS;
00247 #else
00248 uint8_t eemem_mac_address[8] EEMEM = {0x02, 0x11, 0x22, 0xff, 0xfe, 0x33, 0x44, 0x55};
00249 #endif
00250 #ifdef SERVER_NAME
00251 uint8_t eemem_server_name[16] EEMEM = SERVER_NAME;
00252 #else
00253 uint8_t eemem_server_name[16] EEMEM = "Raven_webserver";
00254 #endif
00255 #ifdef DOMAIN_NAME
00256 uint8_t eemem_domain_name[30] EEMEM = DOMAIN_NAME
00257 #else
00258 uint8_t eemem_domain_name[30] EEMEM = "localhost";
00259 #endif
00260 #endif /*AVR_WEBSERVER */
00261 
00262 #ifdef NODE_ID
00263 uint16_t eemem_nodeid EEMEM = NODEID;
00264 #else
00265 uint16_t eemem_nodeid EEMEM = 0;
00266 #endif
00267 #ifdef CHANNEL_802_15_4
00268 uint8_t eemem_channel[2] EEMEM = {CHANNEL_802_15_4, ~CHANNEL_802_15_4};
00269 #else
00270 uint8_t eemem_channel[2] EMEM = {26, ~26};
00271 #endif
00272 #ifdef IEEE802154_PANID
00273 uint16_t eemem_panid EEMEM = IEEE802154_PANID;
00274 #else
00275 uint16_t eemem_panid EEMEM = 0xABCD;
00276 #endif
00277 #ifdef IEEE802154_PANADDR
00278 uint16_t eemem_panaddr EEMEM = IEEE802154_PANADDR;
00279 #else
00280 uint16_t eemem_panaddr EEMEM = 0;
00281 #endif
00282 #ifdef RF230_MAX_TX_POWER
00283 uint8_t eemem_txpower EEMEM = RF230_MAX_TX_POWER;
00284 #else
00285 uint8_t eemem_txpower EEMEM = 0;
00286 #endif
00287 
00288 static uint8_t
00289 get_channel_from_eeprom() {
00290   uint8_t x[2];
00291   *(uint16_t *)x = eeprom_read_word ((uint16_t *)&eemem_channel);
00292 /* Don't return an invalid channel number */
00293   if( (x[0]<11) || (x[0] > 26)) x[1]=x[0];
00294 /* Do exclusive or test on the two values read */
00295   if((uint8_t)x[0]!=(uint8_t)~x[1]) {//~x[1] can promote comparison to 16 bit
00296 /* Verification fails, rewrite everything */
00297     uint8_t i,buffer[32];
00298     PRINTD("EEPROM is corrupt, rewriting with defaults.\n");
00299 #if CONTIKI_CONF_RANDOM_MAC
00300     PRINTA("Generating random MAC address.\n");
00301     generate_new_eui64(&buffer);
00302 #else
00303     for (i=0;i<sizeof(default_mac_address);i++) buffer[i] = pgm_read_byte_near(default_mac_address+i);
00304 #endif
00305     cli();
00306     eeprom_write_block(&buffer,  &eemem_mac_address, sizeof(eemem_mac_address));
00307     for (i=0;i<sizeof(default_server_name);i++) buffer[i] = pgm_read_byte_near(default_server_name+i);
00308     eeprom_write_block(&buffer,  &eemem_server_name, sizeof(eemem_server_name));
00309     for (i=0;i<sizeof(default_domain_name);i++) buffer[i] = pgm_read_byte_near(default_domain_name+i);
00310     eeprom_write_block(&buffer,  &eemem_domain_name, sizeof(eemem_domain_name));
00311     eeprom_write_word(&eemem_panid  , pgm_read_word_near(&default_panid));
00312     eeprom_write_word(&eemem_panaddr, pgm_read_word_near(&default_panaddr));
00313     eeprom_write_byte(&eemem_txpower, pgm_read_byte_near(&default_txpower));
00314     eeprom_write_word(&eemem_nodeid, pgm_read_word_near(&default_nodeid));
00315     x[0] = pgm_read_byte_near(&default_channel);
00316     x[1]= ~x[0];
00317     eeprom_write_word((uint16_t *)&eemem_channel, *(uint16_t *)x);
00318         sei();
00319   }
00320 /* Always returns a valid channel */
00321   return x[0];
00322 }
00323 static bool
00324 get_eui64_from_eeprom(uint8_t macptr[sizeof(rimeaddr_t)]) {
00325   cli();
00326   eeprom_read_block ((void *)macptr, &eemem_mac_address, sizeof(rimeaddr_t));
00327   sei();
00328   return macptr[0]!=0xFF;
00329 }
00330 static uint16_t
00331 get_panid_from_eeprom(void) {
00332   return eeprom_read_word(&eemem_panid);
00333 }
00334 static uint16_t
00335 get_panaddr_from_eeprom(void) {
00336   return eeprom_read_word (&eemem_panaddr);
00337 }
00338 static uint8_t
00339 get_txpower_from_eeprom(void)
00340 {
00341   return eeprom_read_byte(&eemem_txpower);
00342 }

00348 #if 0

00350 #define settings_add_uint8(...) 0
00351 #define settings_add_uint16(...) 0

00360 static uint8_t
00361 get_channel_from_eeprom() {
00362   uint8_t x;
00363   size_t  size = 1;
00364   if (settings_get(SETTINGS_KEY_CHANNEL, 0,(unsigned char*)&x, &size) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00365     if ((x<11) || (x>26)) {
00366       PRINTF("Unusual RF channel %u in EEPROM\n",x);
00367         }
00368     PRINTD("<=Get RF channel %u.\n",x);
00369   } else {
00370     x = pgm_read_byte_near(&default_channel);
00371     if (settings_add_uint8(SETTINGS_KEY_CHANNEL,x ) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00372       PRINTD("->Set EEPROM RF channel to %d.\n",x);
00373     }
00374   }
00375   return x;
00376 }
00377 static bool
00378 get_eui64_from_eeprom(uint8_t macptr[8]) {
00379   size_t size = sizeof(rimeaddr_t); 
00380   if(settings_get(SETTINGS_KEY_EUI64, 0, (unsigned char*)macptr, &size) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00381     PRINTD("<=Get MAC address.\n");
00382     return true;                
00383   }
00384 #if CONTIKI_CONF_RANDOM_MAC
00385   PRINTD("--Generating random MAC address.\n");
00386   generate_new_eui64(macptr);
00387 #else
00388   {uint8_t i;for (i=0;i<8;i++) macptr[i] = pgm_read_byte_near(default_mac_address+i);}
00389 #endif
00390   if (settings_add(SETTINGS_KEY_EUI64,(unsigned char*)macptr,8)) {
00391     PRINTD("->Set EEPROM MAC address.\n");
00392   }
00393   return true;
00394 }
00395 static uint16_t
00396 get_panid_from_eeprom(void) {
00397   uint16_t x;
00398   size_t  size = 2;
00399   if (settings_get(SETTINGS_KEY_PAN_ID, 0,(unsigned char*)&x, &size) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00400     PRINTD("<-Get PAN ID of %04x.\n",x);
00401   } else {
00402     x=pgm_read_word_near(&default_panid);
00403     if (settings_add_uint16(SETTINGS_KEY_PAN_ID,x)==SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00404       PRINTD("->Set EEPROM PAN ID to %04x.\n",x);
00405     }
00406   }
00407   return x;
00408 }
00409 static uint16_t
00410 get_panaddr_from_eeprom(void) {
00411   uint16_t x;
00412   size_t  size = 2;
00413   if (settings_get(SETTINGS_KEY_PAN_ADDR, 0,(unsigned char*)&x, &size) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00414     PRINTD("<-Get PAN address of %04x.\n",x);
00415   } else {
00416     x=pgm_read_word_near(&default_panaddr);
00417     if (settings_add_uint16(SETTINGS_KEY_PAN_ADDR,x)==SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00418       PRINTD("->Set EEPROM PAN address to %04x.\n",x);
00419     }
00420   }        
00421   return x;
00422 }
00423 static uint8_t
00424 get_txpower_from_eeprom(void) {
00425   uint8_t x;
00426   size_t  size = 1;
00427   if (settings_get(SETTINGS_KEY_TXPOWER, 0,(unsigned char*)&x, &size) == SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00428     PRINTD("<-Get tx power of %d. (0=max)\n",x);
00429   } else {
00430     x=pgm_read_byte_near(&default_txpower);
00431     if (settings_add_uint8(SETTINGS_KEY_TXPOWER,x)==SETTINGS_STATUS_OK) {
00432       PRINTD("->Set EEPROM tx power of %d. (0=max)\n",x);
00433     }
00434   }
00435   return x;
00436 }
00437 #endif /* CONTIKI_CONF_SETTINGS_MANAGER */

00439 /*-------------------------Low level initialization------------------------*/
00440 /*------Done in a subroutine to keep main routine stack usage small--------*/
00441 void initialize(void)
00442 {
00443   watchdog_init();
00444   watchdog_start();
00445 
00446 #ifdef RAVEN_LCD_INTERFACE
00447   /* First rs232 port for Raven 3290 port */
00448   rs232_init(RS232_PORT_0, USART_BAUD_38400,USART_PARITY_NONE | USART_STOP_BITS_1 | USART_DATA_BITS_8);
00449   /* Set input handler for 3290 port */
00450   rs232_set_input(0,raven_lcd_serial_input);
00451 #endif
00452 
00453   /* Second rs232 port for debugging */
00454   rs232_init(RS232_PORT_1, USART_BAUD_57600,USART_PARITY_NONE | USART_STOP_BITS_1 | USART_DATA_BITS_8);
00455   /* Redirect stdout to second port */
00456   rs232_redirect_stdout(RS232_PORT_1);
00457   clock_init();
00458 
00459 #if STACKMONITOR
00460   /* Simple stack pointer highwater monitor. Checks for magic numbers in the main
00461    * loop. In conjuction with PERIODICPRINTS, never-used stack will be printed
00462    * every STACKMONITOR seconds.
00463    */
00464 {
00465 extern uint16_t __bss_end;
00466 uint16_t p=(uint16_t)&__bss_end;
00467     do {
00468       *(uint16_t *)p = 0x4242;
00469       p+=10;
00470     } while (p<SP-10); //don't overwrite our own stack
00471 }
00472 #endif
00473 
00474 /* Get a random (or probably different) seed for the 802.15.4 packet sequence number.
00475  * Some layers will ignore duplicates found in a history (e.g. Contikimac)
00476  * causing the initial packets to be ignored after a short-cycle restart.
00477  */
00478  random_init(rng_get_uint8());
00479 
00480 #define CONF_CALIBRATE_OSCCAL 0
00481 #if CONF_CALIBRATE_OSCCAL
00482 void calibrate_rc_osc_32k();
00483 {
00484 extern uint8_t osccal_calibrated;
00485 uint8_t i;
00486   PRINTD("\nBefore calibration OSCCAL=%x\n",OSCCAL);
00487   for (i=0;i<10;i++) { 
00488     calibrate_rc_osc_32k();  
00489     PRINTD("Calibrated=%x\n",osccal_calibrated);
00490 //#include <util/delay_basic.h>
00491 //#define delay_us( us )   ( _delay_loop_2(1+(us*F_CPU)/4000000UL) ) 
00492 //   delay_us(50000);
00493  }
00494    clock_init();
00495 }
00496 #endif 
00497 
00498   PRINTA("\n*******Booting %s*******\n",CONTIKI_VERSION_STRING);
00499 
00500 /* rtimers needed for radio cycling */
00501   rtimer_init();
00502 
00503  /* Initialize process subsystem */
00504   process_init();
00505 
00506   /* etimers must be started before ctimer_init */
00507   process_start(&etimer_process, NULL);
00508 
00509 #if RF230BB
00510 
00511   ctimer_init();
00512   /* Start radio and radio receive process */
00513   NETSTACK_RADIO.init();
00514 
00515   /* Set addresses BEFORE starting tcpip process */
00516 
00517   rimeaddr_t addr;
00518 //  memset(&addr, 0, sizeof(rimeaddr_t));
00519   get_eui64_from_eeprom(addr.u8);
00520  
00521 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6 
00522   memcpy(&uip_lladdr.addr, &addr.u8, sizeof(rimeaddr_t));
00523 #elif WITH_NODE_ID
00524   node_id=get_panaddr_from_eeprom();
00525   addr.u8[1]=node_id&0xff;
00526   addr.u8[0]=(node_id&0xff00)>>8;
00527   PRINTA("Node ID from eeprom: %X\n",node_id);
00528 #endif  
00529   rimeaddr_set_node_addr(&addr); 
00530 
00531   rf230_set_pan_addr(
00532         get_panid_from_eeprom(),
00533         get_panaddr_from_eeprom(),
00534         (uint8_t *)&addr.u8
00535   );
00536   rf230_set_channel(get_channel_from_eeprom());
00537   rf230_set_txpower(get_txpower_from_eeprom());
00538 
00539 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6
00540   PRINTA("MAC address %x:%x:%x:%x:%x:%x:%x:%x\n\r",addr.u8[0],addr.u8[1],addr.u8[2],addr.u8[3],addr.u8[4],addr.u8[5],addr.u8[6],addr.u8[7]);
00541 #else
00542   PRINTA("MAC address ");
00543   uint8_t i;
00544   for (i=sizeof(rimeaddr_t); i>0; i--){
00545     PRINTA("%x:",addr.u8[i-1]);
00546   }
00547   PRINTA("\n");
00548 #endif
00549 
00550   /* Initialize stack protocols */
00551   queuebuf_init();
00552   NETSTACK_RDC.init();
00553   NETSTACK_MAC.init();
00554   NETSTACK_NETWORK.init();
00555 
00556 #if ANNOUNCE_BOOT
00557   PRINTA("%s %s, channel %u power %u",NETSTACK_MAC.name, NETSTACK_RDC.name,rf230_get_channel()),rf230_get_txpower();
00558   if (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval) {//function pointer is zero for sicslowmac
00559     unsigned short tmp;
00560     tmp=CLOCK_SECOND / (NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval == 0 ? 1:\
00561                                    NETSTACK_RDC.channel_check_interval());
00562     if (tmp<65535) PRINTA(", check rate %u Hz",tmp);
00563   }
00564   PRINTA("\n");
00565 
00566 #if UIP_CONF_IPV6_RPL
00567   PRINTA("RPL Enabled\n");
00568 #endif
00569 #if UIP_CONF_ROUTER
00570   PRINTA("Routing Enabled\n");
00571 #endif
00572 
00573 #endif /* ANNOUNCE_BOOT */
00574 
00575 // rime_init(rime_udp_init(NULL));
00576 // uip_router_register(&rimeroute);
00577 
00578   process_start(&tcpip_process, NULL);
00579 
00580 #else /* !RF230BB */
00581 /* Original RF230 combined mac/radio driver */
00582 /* mac process must be started before tcpip process! */
00583   process_start(&mac_process, NULL);
00584   process_start(&tcpip_process, NULL);
00585 #endif /* RF230BB */
00586 
00587 #ifdef RAVEN_LCD_INTERFACE
00588   process_start(&raven_lcd_process, NULL);
00589 #endif
00590 
00591   /* Autostart other processes */
00592   autostart_start(autostart_processes);
00593 
00594   //Give ourselves a prefix
00595   // init_net();
00596 
00597   /*---If using coffee file system create initial web content if necessary---*/
00598 #if COFFEE_FILES
00599   int fa = cfs_open( "/index.html", CFS_READ);
00600   if (fa<0) {     //Make some default web content
00601     PRINTA("No index.html file found, creating upload.html!\n");
00602     PRINTA("Formatting FLASH file system for coffee...");
00603     cfs_coffee_format();
00604     PRINTA("Done!\n");
00605     fa = cfs_open( "/index.html", CFS_WRITE);
00606     int r = cfs_write(fa, &"It works!", 9);
00607     if (r<0) PRINTA("Can''t create /index.html!\n");
00608     cfs_close(fa);
00609 //  fa = cfs_open("upload.html"), CFW_WRITE);
00610 // <html><body><form action="upload.html" enctype="multipart/form-data" method="post"><input name="userfile" type="file" size="50" /><input value="Upload" type="submit" /></form></body></html>
00611   }
00612 #endif /* COFFEE_FILES */
00613 
00614 /* Add addresses for testing */
00615 #if 0
00616 {  
00617   uip_ip6addr_t ipaddr;
00618   uip_ip6addr(&ipaddr, 0xaaaa, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
00619   uip_ds6_addr_add(&ipaddr, 0, ADDR_AUTOCONF);
00620 //  uip_ds6_prefix_add(&ipaddr,64,0);
00621 }
00622 #endif
00623 
00624 /*--------------------------Announce the configuration---------------------*/
00625 #if ANNOUNCE_BOOT
00626 {
00627 #if AVR_WEBSERVER
00628   uint8_t i;
00629   char buf[80];
00630   unsigned int size;
00631 
00632   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00633         if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {     
00634            httpd_cgi_sprint_ip6(uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr,buf);
00635        PRINTA("IPv6 Address: %s\n",buf);
00636         }
00637   }
00638    cli();
00639    eeprom_read_block (buf,eemem_server_name, sizeof(eemem_server_name));
00640    sei();
00641    buf[sizeof(eemem_server_name)]=0;
00642    PRINTA("%s",buf);
00643    cli();
00644    eeprom_read_block (buf,eemem_domain_name, sizeof(eemem_domain_name));
00645    sei();
00646    buf[sizeof(eemem_domain_name)]=0;
00647    size=httpd_fs_get_size();
00648 #ifndef COFFEE_FILES
00649    PRINTA(".%s online with fixed %u byte web content\n",buf,size);
00650 #elif COFFEE_FILES==1
00651    PRINTA(".%s online with static %u byte EEPROM file system\n",buf,size);
00652 #elif COFFEE_FILES==2
00653    PRINTA(".%s online with dynamic %u KB EEPROM file system\n",buf,size>>10);
00654 #elif COFFEE_FILES==3
00655    PRINTA(".%s online with static %u byte program memory file system\n",buf,size);
00656 #elif COFFEE_FILES==4
00657    PRINTA(".%s online with dynamic %u KB program memory file system\n",buf,size>>10);
00658 #endif /* COFFEE_FILES */
00659 
00660 #else
00661    PRINTA("Online\n");
00662 #endif /* AVR_WEBSERVER */
00663 
00664 #endif /* ANNOUNCE_BOOT */
00665 }
00666 }
00667 
00668 #if ROUTES && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00669 static void
00670 ipaddr_add(const uip_ipaddr_t *addr)
00671 {
00672   uint16_t a;
00673   int8_t i, f;
00674   for(i = 0, f = 0; i < sizeof(uip_ipaddr_t); i += 2) {
00675     a = (addr->u8[i] << 8) + addr->u8[i + 1];
00676     if(a == 0 && f >= 0) {
00677       if(f++ == 0) PRINTF("::");
00678     } else {
00679       if(f > 0) {
00680         f = -1;
00681       } else if(i > 0) {
00682         PRINTF(":");
00683       }
00684       PRINTF("%x",a);
00685     }
00686   }
00687 }
00688 #endif
00689 
00690 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00691 /*------------------------- Main Scheduler loop----------------------------*/
00692 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00693 int
00694 main(void)
00695 {
00696   initialize();
00697 
00698   while(1) {
00699     process_run();
00700     watchdog_periodic();
00701 
00702 #if 0
00703 /* Various entry points for debugging in the AVR Studio simulator.
00704  * Set as next statement and step into the routine.
00705  */
00706     NETSTACK_RADIO.send(packetbuf_hdrptr(), 42);
00707     process_poll(&rf230_process);
00708     packetbuf_clear();
00709     len = rf230_read(packetbuf_dataptr(), PACKETBUF_SIZE);
00710     packetbuf_set_datalen(42);
00711     NETSTACK_RDC.input();
00712 #endif
00713 
00714 #if 0
00715 /* Clock.c can trigger a periodic PLL calibration in the RF230BB driver.
00716  * This can show when that happens.
00717  */
00718     extern uint8_t rf230_calibrated;
00719     if (rf230_calibrated) {
00720       PRINTD("\nRF230 calibrated!\n");
00721       rf230_calibrated=0;
00722     }
00723 #endif
00724 
00725 #if DEBUGFLOWSIZE
00726   if (debugflowsize) {
00727     debugflow[debugflowsize]=0;
00728     PRINTF("%s",debugflow);
00729     debugflowsize=0;
00730    }
00731 #endif
00732 
00733     watchdog_periodic();
00734 
00735 #if PERIODICPRINTS
00736 #if TESTRTIMER
00737 /* Timeout can be increased up to 8 seconds maximum.
00738  * A one second cycle is convenient for triggering the various debug printouts.
00739  * The triggers are staggered to avoid printing everything at once.
00740  */
00741     if (rtimerflag) {
00742       rtimer_set(&rt, RTIMER_NOW()+ RTIMER_ARCH_SECOND*1UL, 1,(void *) rtimercycle, NULL);
00743       rtimerflag=0;
00744 #else
00745   if (clocktime!=clock_seconds()) {
00746      clocktime=clock_seconds();
00747 #endif
00748 
00749 #if STAMPS
00750 if ((clocktime%STAMPS)==0) {
00751 #if ENERGEST_CONF_ON
00752 #include "lib/print-stats.h"
00753         print_stats();
00754 #elif RADIOSTATS
00755 extern volatile unsigned long radioontime;
00756   PRINTF("%u(%u)s\n",clocktime,radioontime);
00757 #else
00758   PRINTF("%us\n",clocktime);
00759 #endif
00760 
00761 }
00762 #endif
00763 #if TESTRTIMER
00764       clocktime+=1;
00765 #endif
00766 
00767 #if PINGS && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00768 extern void raven_ping6(void); 
00769 if ((clocktime%PINGS)==1) {
00770   PRINTF("**Ping\n");
00771   raven_ping6();
00772 }
00773 #endif
00774 
00775 #if ROUTES && UIP_CONF_IPV6
00776 if ((clocktime%ROUTES)==2) {
00777       
00778 extern uip_ds6_nbr_t uip_ds6_nbr_cache[];
00779 extern uip_ds6_route_t uip_ds6_routing_table[];
00780 extern uip_ds6_netif_t uip_ds6_if;
00781 
00782   uint8_t i,j;
00783   PRINTF("\nAddresses [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB);
00784   for (i=0;i<UIP_DS6_ADDR_NB;i++) {
00785     if (uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].isused) {
00786       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_if.addr_list[i].ipaddr);
00787       PRINTF("\n");
00788     }
00789   }
00790   PRINTF("\nNeighbors [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_NBR_NB);
00791   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_NBR_NB; i++) {
00792     if(uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].isused) {
00793       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_nbr_cache[i].ipaddr);
00794       PRINTF("\n");
00795       j=0;
00796     }
00797   }
00798   if (j) PRINTF("  <none>");
00799   PRINTF("\nRoutes [%u max]\n",UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB);
00800   for(i = 0,j=1; i < UIP_DS6_ROUTE_NB; i++) {
00801     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].isused) {
00802       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].ipaddr);
00803       PRINTF("/%u (via ", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].length);
00804       ipaddr_add(&uip_ds6_routing_table[i].nexthop);
00805  //     if(uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime < 600) {
00806         PRINTF(") %lus\n", uip_ds6_routing_table[i].state.lifetime);
00807  //     } else {
00808  //       PRINTF(")\n");
00809  //     }
00810       j=0;
00811     }
00812   }
00813   if (j) PRINTF("  <none>");
00814   PRINTF("\n---------\n");
00815 }
00816 #endif
00817 
00818 #if STACKMONITOR
00819 if ((clocktime%STACKMONITOR)==3) {
00820   extern uint16_t __bss_end;
00821   uint16_t p=(uint16_t)&__bss_end;
00822   do {
00823     if (*(uint16_t *)p != 0x4242) {
00824       PRINTF("Never-used stack > %d bytes\n",p-(uint16_t)&__bss_end);
00825       break;
00826     }
00827     p+=10;
00828   } while (p<RAMEND-10);
00829 }
00830 #endif
00831 
00832     }
00833 #endif /* PERIODICPRINTS */
00834 
00835 #if RF230BB&&0
00836 extern uint8_t rf230processflag;
00837     if (rf230processflag) {
00838       PRINTF("rf230p%d",rf230processflag);
00839       rf230processflag=0;
00840     }
00841 #endif
00842 
00843 #if RF230BB&&0
00844 extern uint8_t rf230_interrupt_flag;
00845     if (rf230_interrupt_flag) {
00846  //   if (rf230_interrupt_flag!=11) {
00847         PRINTF("**RI%u",rf230_interrupt_flag);
00848  //   }
00849       rf230_interrupt_flag=0;
00850     }
00851 #endif
00852   }
00853   return 0;
00854 }

00858 void log_message(char *m1, char *m2)
00859 {
00860   PRINTF("%s%s\n", m1, m2);
